page.title: 08BRITANNIA PARK - CONTROVERSY
page.content:
{Britannia Park}is a Theme Park which is being built in 350 acres of park land just north of Ilkeston. The first phase has cost Â£18 million. The next phase will cost even more.
It was opened against a background of controversy. {Friends of Shipley Park} have fought two court cases against the owners. The builders have also been to court with nine different cases against the County Council.
Although the project has found jobs for{400 people,}local residents are worried about the noise and congestion on the local roads. Even the opening was full of problems. The park was largely unfinished by the time that {Henry Cooper}performed the opening ceremony.
